intro: Raphionacme arabica, commonly known as the Arabian raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can tolerate high temperatures. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
